issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: Driver holds instance for ZkHiveLockManager. In turn SqlQuery holds it too. So if we have many not closed queries we will get many zk sessions.
fields.summary: Zookeeper Lock Manager leaks zookeeper connections.

comments.body: Simple patch don't eat exceptions, but rethrow them. And close zookeeper instance.

I propose to release HiveLockManager right at the end of driver execution.
I checked code, but not sure that such change is possible yet.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12636933
[~octo47] Can you create a RB request on https://reviews.apache.org/r/new/

This patch no longer applies due to the changes to Driver.java in HIVE-5843.  

I don't think you want to close the lock manager (now a transaction manager) in releaseLocks.  That is called when any query is done.  But another query could be run on the same Driver object, which would now not have a transaction manager to work with.
